meanings.definition: Join (metal pieces) by heating the edges and pressing them together.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith welded the two iron bars to create a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic welded the broken exhaust pipe back together.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly welded the metal pieces upside down, creating a funny-looking sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was welded through shared experiences and trust.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully welded the intricate design onto the metal gate.

meanings.definition: Fused together by heat or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The welded metal joint held firm under the weight of the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: The welded seams on the pipeline ensured no leaks would occur.
meanings.sent3: The welded edges of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to separate them.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts felt welded together after overcoming a challenging situation.
meanings.sent5: The welded connection between the two components was flawless and secure.
